alert.note: Alert for Pinal (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 12 at 1:51PM MST until August 12 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tucson has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southwestern Pinal County in southeastern Arizona... * Until 500 PM MST. * At 151 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Up to 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Chui-Chu, Cockleburr, Jack Rabbit, Shopishk and East Chui-Chu. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
